net.xuset.objectIO.netObj

Interface NetObject

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNetObject, ArrayNetClass, DummyNetClass, HashNetClass, NetClass, NetFunc, NetVar, NetVar.nBool, NetVar.nDouble, NetVar.nFloat, NetVar.nInt, NetVar.nLong, NetVar.nString

    public interface NetObject
    This class outlines the functions necessary for synchronizing data across connections. The purpose of NetObject along with it's implementations is to provide an easy to to keep data synchronized between connections. The implementations of this interface serialize their state into MarkupMsg objects. The message object can then be sent through a Connection and deserialized so the two remote NetObject instances share the same state.

    It is the implementations responsibility to append the id of the NetObject to the message when it is being serialized. The name of a message that is returned by serializeToMsg() or serializeUpdates() must be equal to the id of the NetObject instance. The name of MarkupMsg object can be read and set by calling getName() and setName(String) on the MarkupMsg object.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Gets the unique id associated with this NetObject. The id is used to determine which NetObject an update message or serialized message belongs to.

        No two NetObjects should have the same id and be in the same scope. Meaning it is okay to have two NetObjects with the same id as long as they are not stored together. For example, if you have two NetClass objects with id's "netClass1" and "netClass2" it is okay to have two different NetObjects with the same id as long as they are not stored within the same NetClass object.

        Returns:
        the id of this object

      • serializeToMsg

        MarkupMsg serializeToMsg()
        Converts the entire object into a MarkupMsg object. The entire object's state should be stored inside the returned MarkupMsg object. When the MarkupMsg object gets deserialized, the new state of the object should be identical to when it was serialized.
        Returns:
        a MarkupMsg object with the entire state of the NetObject stored.

      • deserializeMsg

        void deserializeMsg(MarkupMsg msg)
        Deserialize the given MarkupMsg object. The entire state of the NetObject does not have to be present in the given MarkupMsg object for this method to work correctly. It can take a partial or complete state and update itself accordingly.
        Parameters:
        msg -

      • hasUpdates

        boolean hasUpdates()
        Indicates if the objects state has changed since the last call to serializeUpdates().
        Returns:
        true if the object has changed and can be updated.

      • serializeUpdates

        MarkupMsg serializeUpdates()
        This method only serializes the state that has changed since the last call to this method. serializeToMsg() converts the entire state into a MarkupMsg object but this method converts only what has changed since the last call. This method is significantly more bandwidth friendly than serializeToMsg(). If the object has not changed since the last call, an empty MarkupMsg object is returned.
        Returns:
        the updated and partial state of the object as a MarkupMsg object
